articles.title: Deere (DE) Is Considered a Good Investment by Brokers: Is That True?
articles.mainIdea: Deere (DE) Is Considered a Good Investment by Brokers: Is That True?
articles.summary: Zacks: Deere (DE) Is Considered a Good Investment by Brokers: Is That True?. Based on the average brokerage recommendation (ABR), Deere (DE) should be added to one's portfolio. Wall Street analysts' overly optimistic recommendations cast doubt on the effectiveness of this highly sought-after metric. So, is the stock worth buying?

articles.title: How Recent Shifts in Tech and Cycles Are Rewriting the Story for Deere
articles.mainIdea: How Recent Shifts in Tech and Cycles Are Rewriting the Story for Deere
articles.summary: Simply Wall St.: How Recent Shifts in Tech and Cycles Are Rewriting the Story for Deere. Deere's fair value estimate has nudged higher to about $526.91 per share, reflecting a slightly less negative revenue growth outlook and a marginally higher discount rate that together point to a more resilient long term narrative. This subtle upward shift is being driven by growing conviction in the earnings power tied to Precision Ag adoption and Deere's technology ecosystem, even as analysts remain mindful of cyclical and used equipment pressures. Stay tuned to see how investors can track...

articles.title: John Deere agrees to buy US construction tech firm Tenna
articles.mainIdea: John Deere agrees to buy US construction tech firm Tenna
articles.summary: World Construction Network: John Deere agrees to buy US construction tech firm Tenna. Tenna will continue to serve construction clients independently after the acquisition is complete.

articles.summary: StockStory: 3 Low-Volatility Stocks with Questionable Fundamentals. Low-volatility stocks may offer stability, but that often comes at the cost of slower growth and the upside potential of more dynamic companies. Related tickers mentioned: DCOM, DCOMP, SEM.

articles.title: Metavista3D to Showcase Latest 3D Display Innovations at CES 2026
articles.mainIdea: Metavista3D to Showcase Latest 3D Display Innovations at CES 2026
articles.summary: Newsfile: Metavista3D to Showcase Latest 3D Display Innovations at CES 2026. Vancouver, British Columbia--(Newsfile Corp. - December 19, 2025) - Metavista3D Inc. (TSXV: DDD) (FSE: E3T) ("Metavista3D" or the "Company") is pleased to announce that it will showcase a range of advanced 3D display technologies at CES 2026, taking place January 6-9, 2026, in Las Vegas, Nevada.CES, the world's premier technology event, will spotlight breakthrough innovations, with artificial intelligence and quantum technologies expected to be among the key themes.Metavista3D will exhibit at... Related tickers mentioned: 005380.KS, CAT, DDD.V, E3T.F, LPL.
